API Documentation¶

Data processing¶

src.data._get_iso_codes(path: str = '../data/iso-codes.csv') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Return DataFrame of ISO 3166-1 country codes.

src.data._get_time_series_cases(url: str = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/web-data/data/cases_time.csv') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Return time-series data of worldwide infections.

src.data._get_us_cases(url: str = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/web-data/data/cases.csv') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Return DataFrame of US most recent cumulative infection data.

src.data._get_world_population(path: str = '../data/worldbank-population-2018.csv') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Return DataFrame of world population.

src.data._get_worldwide_cases(url: str = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/web-data/data/cases_country.csv') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Return DataFrame of most recent worldwide cumulative infection data.

src.data._to_date(x: pandas.core.series.Series) → pandas.core.series.Series[source]¶

Return normalised DateTime series.

src.data.get_country_data(time_source: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, country: str) → Tuple[source]¶

Return DataFrame of worldwide time-series statistics on confirmed cases, deaths, recovered, etc. for a given country.

Parameters

  • time_source (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame resulting from _get_time_series_cases().

  • country (str) – Country name.

Returns

time_data, first_case, last_update – Tuple consisting of time_data (DataFrame), first_case (Timestamp) and last_update (Timestamp)

Return type

Tuple

src.data.get_most_affected(world_source: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, n: int = 10) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Return DataFrame of top n most affected countries (as measued by number of confirmed cases).

Note that the data is returned in tidy format.

Parameters

  • world_source (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame resulting from _get_worldwide_cases().

  • n (int, optional) – Number of countries to include, by default 10

Returns

melted – DataFrame of top n most affected countries.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Plots¶

src.plots.create_heatmap(selection: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, column: str = 'norm_confirmed') → altair.vegalite.v4.api.Chart[source]¶

Return alt.Chart heatmap displaying different transformations of confirmed cases.

Parameters

  • selection (pd.DataFrame) – Countries to compare, passed by st.multiselect in app.py.

  • column (str) – Value to plot. Default is ‘norm_confirmed’, which is the proportion of confirmed cases relative to confirmed cases in most recent update.

Returns

Return type

alt.Chart

src.plots.create_map_plot(world_source: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, column: str, country: Union[str, NoneType] = None) → altair.vegalite.v4.api.Chart[source]¶

Return alt.Chart map of world filled by value of column.

Parameters

  • world_source (pd.DataFrame) –

  • column (str) – Column value to fill country/countries by.

  • country (Optional[str], optional) – If passed a country name, create_map_plot will draw world plot with only the given country coloured. By default None.

Returns

Return type

alt.Chart

src.plots.create_top_n_barplot(world_source: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → altair.vegalite.v4.api.Chart[source]¶

Return alt.Chart stacked barplot of top n most affected countries.

Parameters

world_source (pd.DataFrame) –

Returns

Return type

alt.Chart

src.plots.create_world_barplot(world_source: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → altair.vegalite.v4.api.Chart[source]¶

Return alt.Chart barplot of summary statistics of confirmed cases, recovered patients, deaths and active cases.

Returns

alt.Chart
